formDefinition.formName: Report a near miss while cycling

props.navigateAwayWarning: Are you sure you want to navigate away? All progress in this form will be lost.

5cda9b00a38fc.Name: CY015 - gets Easting and Northing for Near miss form

props.label: Data Protection Policy
props.content:
Portsmouth City Council will process your personal information in accordance with data protection law. The personal details provided by you will be used by Road Safety and Active Travel team for the purposes of informing risk assessments, comparing against collision statistics and used to help prevent future collisions.

Your details will be held on a database and where the law allows, may be shared with other departments within the council for the purposes of informing risk assessments and Road Safety initiatives and education. The council may also be required to disclose personal information to third parties such as for the purposes of preventing or detecting crime or apprehending or prosecuting offenders.

For further information about how the Council collects and uses personal information please visit our website: https://www.portsmouth.gov.uk/ext/the-council/data-protection-privacy-notice

props.label: html 1
props.content:
We are committed to making Portsmouth's roads safer for cyclists and reduce the number of collisions.

Examples of a near miss are, being passed too close, another vehicle pulling in or out across a cyclistâ€™s path, being driven at, and a near left or right hook.This list is not exhaustive however, and what qualifies as a near miss may differ from one cyclist to another - depending on experience and level of confidence. We encourage you to report any incident you feel was a near miss.

If you have experienced a near miss while out on your bike, please let us know by completing this reporting form.

All near miss reports will be reviewed by our Road Safety Team. The information you provide may inform our risk assessments, it will be compared against collision statistics and used to help us prevent future collisions. We may contact you in the future to discuss your report further.

If you wish to report a fault or problem on our roads please visit our 'report it' page Report it

Incidents resulting in a collision or which you believe require police investigation should be reported to Hampshire Police

props.label: emailMain
props.defaultValue:
concat({#emailStart},'Dear ',{contact/First_Name_out},' ',{contact/Surname_out},',\n
\n
Thank you for submitting a form using My Portsmouth.\n
\n
We have received the information, which is also attached to this email. We will use the information you have provided to inform our risk assessments, and may contact you for further information.\n
\n

This is an automated response; please do not reply to this email.\n
\n
Yours sincerely,\n
Portsmouth City Council',{#emailEnd})
